Information panel¶

You can display information in a separate panel when hovering the mouse over an added element by defining the info_mouseover parameter when adding that element to the map. Let’s create a map:

import oneworld as ow
mymap = ow.WebMap(center = [39,-96.8], zoom = 4)

Now let’s add a choropleth to the map. When specifying the info_mouseover keyword upon adding items to the map, oneworld will also add a panel that will display the specified info when the mouse is positionend above the item added. The info_mouseover parameter accepts lists, tuples and the name of a datframe column (if provided) as inputs:

df = ow.load_dataset('farms')
mymap.add_choropleth(json_file = 'us_states.json', json_key = 'GEOID',
                     geoid = 'FIPS', color = 'Region', data = df,
                     style_mouseover = {'color': '#636363'},
                     info_mouseover = 'Name')

The info_mouseover parameter also accepts html format:

mymap.add_panel(title = 'States of USA', width = '130px', height = '70px')

df = ow.load_dataset('farms')
info_l = ['<u>Name:</u><br />&nbsp;&nbsp;'+x for x in df['Name']]

mymap.add_choropleth(json_file = 'us_states.json', json_key = 'GEOID',
                     geoid = 'FIPS', color = 'Region', data = df,
                     style_mouseover = {'color': '#636363'},
                     info_mouseover = info_l)

In the last example, we have explicitly created the information panel, and manually set its title, width and height.
